greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime prime(m) such that floor(prime(m)/m) = n.
comment: a(n+1)/a(n) -> e as n -> infinity, as do the m's.
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..50 (first 29 terms from Robert G. Wilson v)
mathematica: Do[ k = 1; While[ Floor[ Prime[m]/ m] != n, m++ ]; Print[Prime[k] ], {n, 1, 27} ]
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 12 2001
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 13 2001
a(30)-a(50) obtained from the values of A038625 computed by _Jan Büthe_. - _Giovanni Resta_, Sep 01 2018
